job title: Data Analyst II - Envolve Center for Health Behavior Change - St.
job description:
Job Type/Schedule

This position is full-time and works approximately 37.5 hours per week.

Department Name/Job Location

This position is in the Envolve Center for Health Behavior Change. This position is for the Danforth Campus.

Essential Functions

POSITION SUMMARY:

The envolve center for health behavior change is a community-corporate-academic healthcare partnership that advances life-centric health research to improve lives so that communities can thrive. A leading model of collaboration that applies research findings for real-world impact, the Center is a true testament to the value of designing innovative and evidence-based healthcare interventions that translate to the enhanced delivery of managed care.

The individual will primarily be responsible for: 1) assisting in the development of data collection tools; 2) performing data management activities, including cleaning and quality checks; 3) performing statistical analyses; and 4) assisting in the reporting of results to external partners. The individual will work independently with mentoring from senior staff and statisticians, and in collaboration with other project staff.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Manage data collection. Oversee data entry tasks performed by others. Perform quantitative and qualitative data collection and data management tasks, including audits, cleaning, and quality control checks of data.
  • Perform statistical analyses of quantitative data collected. Analyze data using statistical software, interpret statistical test results and summarize findings.
  • Assist with collection and analyses of qualitative data including interviewing, coding and thematic analyses.
  • Help prepare findings for dissemination in various forms (presentations, papers, reports). Draft narrative description of results for journal articles, etc.
  • Other Duties as assigned.
    • Required Qualifications
  • Masters degree and one year of related work experience or Bachelors and 3 years of related work experience in public health, computer science, biostatistics, psychology, social sciences, or related field.
  • Software proficiency: Competency and experience navigating data and utilizing relational databases and reporting tools (Excel, SPSS,). Competence and experience with Qualtrics or other online survey software. At least one year experience using SPSS or other statistical packages to run descriptive analyses.
  • Ability to learn and independently perform new applications and procedures.
  • Strong analytic skills. Attention to detail and accuracy in editing, record-keeping, etc.
  • Ability to verbally communicate complex issues with clarity to different types of audiences (e.g., academic, community).
  • Ability to collaborate with others, working independently and with team members, including students, staff and faculty.
  • Must understand how to analyze and incorporate claims data into research projects and processes.
    • Preferred Qualifications
  • Completed Masters degree in public health, biostatistics, psychology or behavioral science, or related field with 2 years related experience.
  • Experience conducting inferential data analyses and developing appropriate graphical displays of data for manuscripts, reports, and presentations.
  • Understanding of appropriate statistical tests for various analysis situations (including, but not limited to correlation, ANOVA, t-test, chi-square).
  • Extensive experience working with managed care claims data in research settings.
  • Ability to work effectively with a diverse group of community members, staff, and faculty of varying degrees of technical sophistication.
  • Modifications to data management protocols must be made in collaboration with supervisor and project analysts.
  • Submission of findings for dissemination in various forms (presentations, papers, reports) must be reviewed by project analysts, evaluation lead, and principal investigators.
    • Salary Range

    The hiring range for this position is $44,090 - $56,238 annually.

    Benefits

    -Retirement Savings Plan
    • 22 vacation days
    • 8 Paid Holidays

    • Free Metro Link/ Bus pass
    • Free Life Insurance
    • Health, Dental, Vision
    • Health Savings Accounts (HSA)
    • Long Term Disability Insurance
    • Flex Spending Plan
    • Other Benefits
